summary: Cron job workflow gets terminated automatically shortly after deployment, either immediately after scheduling or mid-execution. User experiencing issues with cron job reliability on AWS ECS despite setting workflowRunTimeout and workflowTaskTimeout.
userImpact: Production cron jobs fail to execute reliably after deployment, causing scheduled work to be lost or interrupted.
rootCause: Possible causes identified in discussion: (1) workflow terminated by client before task scheduling, (2) workflow exceeding operational limits (too many buffered events or large gRPC message size), or (3) deployment/worker configuration issue
proposedFix: Migrate to Schedules API which is more powerful and reliable than legacy cron workflows
resolutionDetails: Maintainer closed ticket indicating no action needed on SDK side; recommended using Schedules API instead and suggested community channels for support
keyQuote: This happens when a workflow somehow exceeds some operational limit, for example if there are too many buffered events for that workflow, or if buffered events exceeds the maximum gRPC message size.
